apiClassifier.shortdesc: Enumeration defining field acces types.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Enumeration defining field acces types. A class field can be accessed in readonly, writeonly or readwrite modes.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Obtain an AccessorType instance from a string value.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Obtain an AccessorType instance from a string value. If the value is invalid the READ_WRITE instance will be returned by default.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if the type is read only

apiReturn.apiDesc: true id type is read only, false otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if the type is read only

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if the type is read-write

apiReturn.apiDesc: true id type is read-write, false otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if the type is read-write

apiOperation.shortdesc: Check if the type is write only

apiReturn.apiDesc: true id type is write only, false otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Check if the type is write only

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a string representation of the current instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a string representation of the current instance

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: read only
read write
write only

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines a constructor argument.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Defines a constructor argument. This annotaton is used when a class has a non default constructor. In order to maintain the business restrictions, FlexXB will determine the values of the arguments based on the received xml and call the constructor with those values.
An argument has a reference; the reference is the name of the class field whose value it represents. A non default constructor will most often configure some of the object's fields when called. Since the only available data is the incoming xml, arguments must specify the field the the constructor will modify with the received value.
The class field referenced in the argument must have an annotation defined for it

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get optional flag
the reference field name

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a metadata decorating a class field or class.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface defines a metadata decorating a class field or class. It exposes a name and a type as any class field has a name and a type.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the qualified name of the field that is annotated by the current metadata

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the qualified name of the field that is annotated by the current metadata

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the type of the field that is annotated by the current metadata

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the type of the field that is annotated by the current metadata

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override this method if you require additional tasks to be performed per member added to the class member list.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override this method if you require additional tasks to be performed per member added to the class member list.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the contract interface for a class annotation.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This is the contract interface for a class annotation. A class annotation holds all the annotation structure relevant for that type, being the FlexXB's representation of the type. This representation is used in the (de)serialization process so the engine will know how to generate and parse xml.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a member by field name

apiReturn.apiDesc: Member annotation instance if the field has member metadata defined, null otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a member by field name

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the constructor object which defines the parameters the type constructor takes (default or non-default constructor)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the constructor object which defines the parameters the type constructor takes (default or non-default constructor)

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to a field which is considered the identifier for instances of the specified type.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to a field which is considered the identifier for instances of the specified type. The ID field is used if one wishes to render objects of the current type in a short form, consisting only in the type representation wrapper and the representation of this idField. By this id field, upon deserialization, the engine can identify and extract the correct instance from a model object cache.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the list of members associated with this class

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the list of members associated with this class

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a flag signaling whether the members must be ordered by an integer value or not

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a flag signaling whether the members must be ordered by an integer value or not

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This contract specifies the basic requirements for a FlexXB recognized annotation.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This contract specifies the basic requirements for a FlexXB recognized annotation. The basic annotation must provide a name and a version. Annotations of specific versions will be grouped together.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the annotation's name used in descriptor

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the annotation's name used in descriptor

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the version of the current annotation

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the version of the current annotation

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Commonly used constants.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Commonly used constants.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Id reference
IgnoreOn attribute name
Optional attribute name
Order attribute name
Reference attribute name

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the base class for all annotations.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This is the base class for all annotations. It implements the most basic contract, IAnnotation, and offers the means of retrieving the metadata attributes and their values from the type descriptor. This information is passed inthe constructor via a MetaDescriptor object and one must override the protected methd parse in order to apply the necesary attributes on their own annotations. This mechanism makes the annotations to not require direct access to the xml descriptor of the type being introspected.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Analyze field/class descriptor to extract base informations like field's name and type.

apiParam.apiDesc: MetaDescriptor instance holding the key-value pairs of existing attributes and their values as present in the metadata instrospection

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Analyze field/class descriptor to extract base informations like field's name and type. Override this method in subclasses to add custom parsing of values extracted from the annotation via the MetaDescriptor instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set the version of the current annotation

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set the version of the current annotation

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This contact interface defines the structure of a member annotation, that is, an annotation that is used only on class fields.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This contact interface defines the structure of a member annotation, that is, an annotation that is used only on class fields. A basic member annotation has a reference to its parent class annotation, has an access type (read, write, read/write) and can be ignored in one of the two stages of the engine's processing: serialization or deserialization.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the field accessor

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

apiValue.shortdesc: Flag signaling whether the member annotation must be ignored in a specific processing stage or not.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Flag signaling whether the member annotation must be ignored in a specific processing stage or not.

apiValue.shortdesc: Flag used to signal if the current field's values are id references to objects in the same document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Flag used to signal if the current field's values are id references to objects in the same document.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get the order value of the current annotation.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the order value of the current annotation. This value is used of the owner class annotation has its ordered flag set to true.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in read only mode (only has a getter)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in read only mode (only has a getter)

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in write only mode (only has a setter)

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a flag signaling whether the field can be accesed in write only mode (only has a setter)

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines the class constructor.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Defines the class constructor. Notifies the owner XmlClass whether the described type has a default constructor or not.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get parameter list

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This enumeration defines the preocessing directions supported by the FlexXBEngine: serialize and deserialize

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This enumeration defines the preocessing directions supported by the FlexXBEngine: serialize and deserialize

apiOperation.shortdesc: Obtain a Stage instance from a string value.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Stage instance if the value is valid, null otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Obtain a Stage instance from a string value.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a string representation of the current instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a string representation of the current instance

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Deserialization stage
Serialization stage

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface describes a metadata defined at class level, that is bound to the class owner metadata but defines particularities specific to the class itself.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface describes a metadata defined at class level, that is bound to the class owner metadata but defines particularities specific to the class itself. Good examples to this end are constructor arguments metadata or namespaces used by the class fields. They are not bound to a field name and type but they afect the class representation. This kind of annotations does not usually need a serializer.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the parent class annotation

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines the api structure and access points

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface defines the api structure and access points

apiOperation.shortdesc: Register the type descriptors by the mmeans of an xml file.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Register the type descriptors by the mmeans of an xml file. The content is converted to api components then they are processed to register the type described in the xml file.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Register a type descriptor that is defined by the api components.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Register a type descriptor that is defined by the api components. This is especially useful when not having access to source code.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a dictionary with key-value pairs representing the annotation attribute names and their values.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a dictionary with key-value pairs representing the annotation attribute names and their values. This map is used by the API to construct the actual descriptors used by FlexXB to process the objects and serialized data

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the name of the metadata this class describes

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the name of the metadata this class describes

apiClassifier.shortdesc: API member annotation wrapper.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: API member annotation wrapper. This is the base for member annotation API description. It references the field from the parent type and base attributes that all members will share: version and ignore flags. All member annotations have a version in order to handle different representations of the same object that may appear as appplication develoment evolves. Also, some fields may be ignored in different stages of the processing: serialize or deserialize.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Wrapper holding the class descriptors specified in the xml api descriptor file

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Wrapper holding the class descriptors specified in the xml api descriptor file

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A constructor argument is a way to say to the FlexXB engine that objects of a certain type need a special way to be instantiated in the deserialization stage.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A constructor argument is a way to say to the FlexXB engine that objects of a certain type need a special way to be instantiated in the deserialization stage. A constructor argument is linked to a class field. Usually, when having parameterized arguments, in the constructor these values are mapped to specific fields within the object.

apiParam.apiDesc: name of the class field this argument references
Flag signaling whether this argument is optional or not in the constructor call

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the string representation of the current instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the string representation of the current instance

Get class member reference

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get string representation of the current instance

apiClassifier.shortdesc: API wrapper for a class type.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: API wrapper for a class type. Allows programatically defining all the elements that would normally be specified via annotations.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Add a constructor argument.

apiParam.apiDesc: Flag signaling whether the argument is optional or not (eg. default valued parameters)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add a constructor argument. Arguments are used in order to correctly instantiate objects upon deserialization taking into account default and parameterized constructor.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add a class member

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get string representation of the current instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get string representation of the current instance

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the type

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a cache provider recognised by FlexXB engine.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface defines a cache provider recognised by FlexXB engine.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Clears the cache for all the objects with given class.

apiParam.apiDesc: List of types for which the cache will be flushed. ALL instances will be flushed if null or empty

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Clears the cache for all the objects with given class. If no class is specified, then all cache is cleared.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get an instance of the specified type and with the specified id from the cache

apiReturn.apiDesc: instance defined by id and type if it exists, null otherwise

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get an instance of the specified type and with the specified id from the cache

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets a new instance of the specified object class.

apiParam.apiDesc: parameter list to be used when calling the constructor

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Gets a new instance of the specified object class. The constructor may require arguments which are supplied with the parameters list. After the instance is created it will be placed into the cache.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines whether an object with the given id is aleady cached.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if there is an object cached under the given id and class.

apiParam.apiDesc: the id under which the object should have been cached

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Determines whether an object with the given id is aleady cached.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the interface for objects used by the object cache.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This is the interface for objects used by the object cache. Using this interface will give the implementor objects the ability to get their cleanup method called when they are returned to the cache. The object Cache can store any type of objects, regardless whether they implement IPooledObject or not.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called when the object is released from UI use and back into the object cache

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Called when the object is released from UI use and back into the object cache

apiValue.shortdesc: Easy access to the object type

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Easy access to the object type

apiOperation.shortdesc: Put an object in the cache

apiReturn.apiDesc: if the object was succesfuly cached.

apiParam.apiDesc: the id under which the object will be cached

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Put an object in the cache

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Easy access instance.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the cache for object instances.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
This is the cache for object instances. It maintains a pool for each object type. It works a bit differently... objects in pool are used then released to be used by others. While an object is in use it cannot be reasigned to other. Once the user is done with the instance, it must call releaseInstance method.
ObjectPool does not use an id. Objects are assigned baed on the used state. If all available objects are in use then a new instance will be created. If there is an object released, it will be passed on for use. That's why sometimes it is required to clean the objects after use. This is where the IPooledObject interface comes to use by exposing the clear method which should be implemented by the objects that require some cleanup before being reused.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Tell the cache the display of the attributes started so it will at the starting position in the object cache and return object instances until it runs out.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Tell the cache the display of the attributes started so it will at the starting position in the object cache and return object instances until it runs out. After that new instances will be created and added in the cache

apiOperation.shortdesc: Mark the view instance as unused

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Mark the view instance as unused

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Easy access instance

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Converter for XML objects

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Interface defining how strings can be converted to specific objects and viceversa.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Object whose representation is the specified value

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Converter for Class objects

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Converter for Class objects

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface is used to determine the version of an incoming document.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface is used to determine the version of an incoming document. The version is considerent consistent throughout the entire document and as such the engine will extract it once per received document.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Method that returns the version string al located in the source document.

apiReturn.apiDesc: string value representing the document's version

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Method that returns the version string al located in the source document. Override this method to implement different extraction algorithms.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Description context is the main access point for instructing the engine how to handle a specific serialization format.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Description context is the main access point for instructing the engine how to handle a specific serialization format. The context registers annotations, serializers, converters and offers additional methods to assist the registered serializers with the handling of that serialization format. A context also has an instance of a configuration object; as is the case with different formats, additional settings are needed for configuring the mechanism. One may extend the default configuration object to add settings as needed and reference them in the serializers.
This class must be extended if one is to provide a new serialization format support. In subclasses the method performInitialization must be overriden in order to register serializers, annotations and converters.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the object type associated with the incoming serialized form. Override this method in subclasses because each serialization format has different ways of determining the type of teh object to be used in deserialization.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the object type associated with the incoming serialized form. Override this method in subclasses because each serialization format has different ways of determining the type of teh object to be used in deserialization.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Once a new type has been processed, the context has the chance to handle the descriptors in order to construct internal structures it may need (for example, in handling XML, determine the type by the namespace used).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Once a new type has been processed, the context has the chance to handle the descriptors in order to construct internal structures it may need (for example, in handling XML, determine the type by the namespace used).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Override in subclasses to initialize your context by registering annotations and converters

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Override in subclasses to initialize your context by registering annotations and converters

apiOperation.shortdesc: Register a new annotation and its serializer.

apiParam.apiDesc: the name of the annotation to be registered
instance of the serializer that will handle this annotation
override existing registrations under the same name

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Register a new annotation and its serializer. If it finds a registration with the same name and overrideExisting is set to false, it will disregard the current attempt and keep the old value.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Register a converter instance for a specific type

apiParam.apiDesc: override existing registrations under the same class type

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Register a converter instance for a specific type

apiOperation.shortdesc: Specify api classes that reflect the defined annotations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Specify api classes that reflect the defined annotations.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a configuration instance attached to the current description context

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a configuration instance attached to the current description context

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the descriptor store

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the descriptor store

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Entry point for AS3-? (de)serialization.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Entry point for AS3-? (de)serialization. Allows new annotation registration. The main access point consist of two methods: serialize() and deserialize, each corresponding to the specific stage in the conversion process. By default it registeres the built-in xml handling annotations through the xml description context.

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the api object

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the api object

apiValue.shortdesc: Not a singleton, but an easy access instance.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Not a singleton, but an easy access instance.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This class defines the settings the FlexXB Core and serialization contexts accept in order to control processing.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This class defines the settings the FlexXB Core and serialization contexts accept in order to control processing. You may override this class to add more settings that will be used in your serialization contexts and serializers.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Clone the current configuration object

apiReturn.apiDesc: exact copy of the current object

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Clone the current configuration object

apiOperation.shortdesc: Copy the settings from a configuration instance to another.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Copy the settings from a configuration instance to another. Override this method in subclasses to specify additional settings to be copied.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get a new instance of the Configuration object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get a new instance of the Configuration object. It is used by the clone method to create and populate a copy of this. Override this method to specify subclass instance.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Reference to an ICacheProvider implementor. Use this field to instruct the engine to use an object caching mechanism.

apiValue.shortdesc: Use this flag to control whether to permit logging or not.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Use this flag to control whether to permit logging or not. This is mostly intended for debugging the (de)serialization process. Logging can slow down the process up to 20 times. Use with caution!

apiValue.shortdesc: Set this flag to true if you want the engine to ignore missing content.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Set this flag to true if you want the engine to ignore missing content. By default this field is set on false. By default FlexXB considers a missing serialized content representing a field value as being null and sets null as a value for the appropriate field in the ActionScript object. This is particularly usefull when you need to perform subsequent calls in order to get pieces of data that will in the end construct the final object. By default, after each call, the missing fields in the serialized data will be set to null and such the object will only have the values specified in the last call. Set this flag to true in order to ignore missing values and not set null into the appropiate fields.

apiValue.shortdesc: Serializing persistable objects can be done by including only the fields whose values have been changed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Serializing persistable objects can be done by including only the fields whose values have been changed.

apiValue.shortdesc: Reference to a version extractor instance used to determine automatically the version of an serialized document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Reference to a version extractor instance used to determine automatically the version of an serialized document.

apiValue.shortdesc: Flag signaling the presence or not of a cache provider.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Flag signaling the presence or not of a cache provider. It is a quick determination of the use of a caching mechanism.

apiValue.shortdesc: Flag signaling whether the engine should attempt to automatically determine the version of the received serialized document.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Flag signaling whether the engine should attempt to automatically determine the version of the received serialized document. This setting is overridden by specifying a non empty version value when deserializing the serialized document.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a core that handles a specific way of serializing/deserializing and object.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This interface defines a core that handles a specific way of serializing/deserializing and object. It makes use of a serialization context to inject all the particularities of a specific serialization format. Also, within the context serializers and converters are registered.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers after the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers after the serialization of an AS3 object

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers prior to the serialization of an object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers prior to the serialization of an object

apiOperation.shortdesc: Add a listener to an event being raised by the serialization process to signal various stages.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add a listener to an event being raised by the serialization process to signal various stages. There are four stages being signaled through events: preserialize, postserialize, predeserialize and postdeserialize.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Convert a serialized data (string or byte) to an AS3 object counterpart

apiParam.apiDesc: get the object from the model object cache if it exists, without processing the serialized data

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convert a serialized data (string or byte) to an AS3 object counterpart

apiOperation.shortdesc: Do an early processing of types involved in the communication process if one wants to bypass the lazy processing method implemented by the serializer.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Do an early processing of types involved in the communication process if one wants to bypass the lazy processing method implemented by the serializer.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Remove a registered listener for a stage event

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Remove a registered listener for a stage event

apiOperation.shortdesc: Convert an object to a serialized representation(string - XML - or byte array).

apiReturn.apiDesc: serialized representation of the given object

apiParam.apiDesc: serialize the object in partial mode (only the object's id field)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Convert an object to a serialized representation(string - XML - or byte array).

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the configuration object

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the configuration object

apiValue.shortdesc: Get a reference to the context initiating this serializer

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get a reference to the context initiating this serializer

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Event being raised by the serialization mechanism in order to signal various stages teh process is in.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Event being raised by the serialization mechanism in order to signal various stages teh process is in. The event is raised for each complex object/subobject being processed. There are four types of events one should listen for to hook into the mechanism:
preserialize - raised before the serialization of an object begins
postserialize - raised after the objet's serialization ends
predeserialize - raised before the deserialization of data to an object begins
postdeserialize - raised after the deserialization ends

apiParam.apiDesc: current item undergoing the serialization process
serialized form of the object tree

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a postdeserialize event instance to be raised

apiParam.apiDesc: current object being populated with deserialized data from the data source

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a postdeserialize event instance to be raised

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a postserialize event instance to be raised

apiParam.apiDesc: serialized document being generated up to this point

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a postserialize event instance to be raised

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a predeserialize event instance to be raised

apiParam.apiDesc: current object being populated with deserialized data from the data source

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a predeserialize event instance to be raised

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create a preserialize event instance to be raised

apiParam.apiDesc: serialized document being generated up to this point

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create a preserialize event instance to be raised

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get current object
Get current object's parent
Get serialized document

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems parsing the type descriptor xml

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems parsing the type descriptor xml

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems processing the xml, be it in the serialize or the deserialize stages.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems processing the xml, be it in the serialize or the deserialize stages.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This error is thrown when the FlexXB API engine encounters execution problems.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This error is thrown when the FlexXB API engine encounters execution problems.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Provides a method to uniquely identify objects of a certain type.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Provides a method to uniquely identify objects of a certain type.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get object id
Return the current object's type

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the deserialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post deserialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the deserialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post deserialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step. Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called after the deserialization process of the current object ends.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Called after the deserialization process of the current object ends.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called before the deserialization process of the current object begins.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Called before the deserialization process of the current object begins.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface that can be implemented by FlexXB bound objects to handle cycles in the object graph.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Optional interface that can be implemented by FlexXB bound objects to handle cycles in the object graph.
Normally a cycle in the object graph causes the engine to throw an error. This is not always a desired behavior.Implementing this interface allows the user application to change this behavior.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called when a cycle is detected by the engine to nominate a new object to be serialized instead.

apiReturn.apiDesc: the object to be serialized instead of this or null to instruct the engine to behave as if the object does not implement this interface.

apiParam.apiDesc: reference to the parent object referencing the current one

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Called when a cycle is detected by the engine to nominate a new object to be serialized instead.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the serialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post serialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the serialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post serialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step. Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called before the serialization process of the current object begins.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Interface for an object that requires custom serialization/deserialization into/from a serialization format (XML, JSON, AMF etc.). Use this interface to instruct the engine to delegate the serialization/deserialization task to the object itself.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Main implementation of IPersistable.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Main implementation of IPersistable. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. It should be base for all model objects that need initial state memory capabilities such as IPersistable allows. It uses the methods commit() and rollback() to save the current state or to revert to the previously saved state.
Basically, this object listens for changes to all its public properties and variables and saves the initial value set for that field. Upon commit, the list of initial values is discarded, the new values thus becoming initial values. On rollback, the initial values are reinstated the object returning to the state before eny change had been made.
Note: Subclasses should be decorated with the [Bindable] annotation so all changes to the public fields would be registered.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior to commit being executed, that is, before the change list is discarded.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior to commit being executed, that is, before the change list is discarded.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior to rollback being executed, that is, before the change list is iterated and changed fields having their values reverted to the original ones.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: This is an entry point allowing you to do some computations prior to rollback being executed, that is, before the change list is iterated and changed fields having their values reverted to the original ones.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Stop listening for changes occuring to the object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Stop listening for changes occuring to the object. Configuring listen mode also propagates to watched fields of tye IPersistable. It is usually called before deserialization occurs.

apiOperation.shortdesc: This method allows an object to keep track of changes occuring in its sub-object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
This method allows an object to keep track of changes occuring in its sub-object. In fact it will only monitor the modified status of those sub objects. On rollback or commit it will propagate the commands to those sub-objec it was instructed to watch.
NOTE: Make sure watched objects are also persistable objects

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interface defining an object that can be persisted.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Interface defining an object that can be persisted. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. IPersistable exposes three methods:
modified - check if object has been changed since its last save
commit - make changes done from the last save persistent
rollback - revert to the initial state of the object

apiOperation.shortdesc: Commit the changes made to the object since the previous commit

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Commit the changes made to the object since the previous commit

apiOperation.shortdesc: Revert all the changes made to the object since the previous commit

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Revert all the changes made to the object since the previous commit

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set edit mode. The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever one of its fields is changed.

apiParam.apiDesc: boolean value specifing id the flag must be active or not

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set edit mode. The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever one of its fields is changed. This means that components bound to that object will not update to reflect changes in the object because thare are no change events being dispatched from the object. In cases where you would edit the object in a view for example, it would be akward to change the name and see it changed in the background component displaying basic object details. In conclusion, it is not really an edit flag preventing the object from being edited but rather a notifier for the object to turn into a sort of a black box while that flag is active.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Start listening for changes occuring to the object. Usually called after deserialization completes.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Stop listening for changes occuring to the object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Stop listening for changes occuring to the object. It is usually called before deserialization occurs.

apiValue.shortdesc: The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever one of its fields is changed.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The editMode flag will cause the object not to issue PropertyChangeEvents whenever one of its fields is changed. This means that components bound to that object will not update to reflect changes in the object because thare are no change events being dispatched from the object. In cases where you would edit the object in a view for example, it would be akward to change the name and see it changed in the background component displaying basic object details. In conclusion, it is not really an edit flag preventing the object from being edited but rather a notifier for the object to turn into a sort of a black box while that flag is active.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Get the list of changed items (added removed, moved) in the current instance. Each item is a ChangeTracker instance, a wrapper around the the real list member, containing information on the action took on that object as well as relevant additional data (such as the objects's position). The array is ordered according to the temporal sequence in which the actions were performed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Function that determines wheather the object passed in is an ArrayList. Since Flex 4 a new type was introduced, ArrayList.

apiParam.apiDesc: item to be checked. Can be anything: class, string, plain object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Function that determines wheather the object passed in is a vector. Since Flash 10 a new type was introduced, Vector.

apiParam.apiDesc: item to be checked. Can be anything: class, string, plain object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Function that determines wheather the object passed in is a vector. Since Flash 10 a new type was introduced, Vector. To keep compatibility with other versions people may use we need to do a special check that would not involve direct linking the Vector class incode.
It takes a single parameter, the object to be checked. If the object is a String, it is considered to be the qualified name of the class and it will get inspected for the vector's qualified name being present. If the object is a class or a plain AS3 object, the getQualifiedClassName method will be used to extract the type name and compare it with the vector's name.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines a member of an XmlClass, that is, a field of the class definition.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
Defines a member of an XmlClass, that is, a field of the class definition. The XmlMember is base for XmlAttribute and XmlElement since field values can be rendered as XML in the form of attributes or elements.
A member's alias can define "virtual paths". Virtual paths allow definition of complex xml structures for a field without complicating the model design. Thus, structures can be present in the xml just by adding vistual paths in the alias definition of a member.
Example: Lets assume the xml representation looks like:
<myPathTester> <anotherSub attTest="Thu Mar 19 15:49:32 GMT+0200 2009"/> This is Default!!! <subObject> <id> 2 </id> <subSubObj> <ref> ReferenceTo </ref> </subSubObj> </subObject> </myPathTester>
This would normally translate itself in about 4 model classes. Using virtual paths, one can describe it in just one model class:
[XmlClass(alias="myPathTester", defaultValueField="defaultTest")] public class XmlPathObject { [XmlElement(alias="subObject/id")] public var identity : Number = 2; [XmlElement(alias="subObject/subSubObj/ref")] public var reference : String = "ReferenceTo"; [XmlArray(alias="subObject/list")] public var list : Array; [XmlAttribute(alias="anotherSub/attTest")] public var test : Date = new Date(); [XmlElement()] public var defaultTest : String = "This is Default!!!"
public function XmlPathObject() { } }

apiParam.apiDesc: xml descriptor of the class field

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This class is used to determine the version of an incoming document.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: This class is used to determine the version of an incoming document. The version is considerent consistent throughout the entire document and as such the engine will extract it once per received document. By default, the version extractor searches for an attribute named "version". If you require another kind of processing for versions you should extend this class and override the getVersion method which returns a String and accepts the xml document as source

apiParam.apiDesc: boolean flag signaling whether the version is represented as an element or an attribute

apiOperation.shortdesc: Method that returns the version string al located in the source xml document.

apiReturn.apiDesc: string value representing the document's version

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Method that returns the version string al located in the source xml document. Override this method to implement different extraction algorithms.

apiValue.shortdesc: Set this flag to true if you want special chars to be escaped in the xml.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: Set this flag to true if you want special chars to be escaped in the xml. If set to false, text containing special characters will be enveloped in a CDATA tag. This option applies to xml elements. For xml attributes special chars are automatically escaped.
